sentences.english: My acquaintance confirmed that his fellow postmen were neither terribly nice nor terribly nasty.
sentences.chinese: 我這位熟人證明，他的同事們既不太好，也不太差。

sentences.english: acquaintances often gather to play for fun, with no wagering.
sentences.chinese: 熟人經常聚在一起打麻將玩，不下注。

sentences.english: He and Wang Shuo had all the necessary contacts.
sentences.chinese: 他和王朔都認識出版必要的熟人門路。

sentences.english: Friends and even casual acquaintances will hold the keys to a dilemma you are trying to unknot .
sentences.chinese: 朋友和熟人，甚至隨意將舉行的鑰匙，一個兩難你想。

sentences.english: I started asking acquaintances if anyone was looking for a good sushi chef.
sentences.chinese: 我開始向熟人打聽是否有人需要一個優秀的壽司主廚。

sentences.english: Tap into your network of friends and acquaintances.
sentences.chinese: 和你的朋友以及熟人打成一片。

sentences.english: One of the escaped, Luo Guangbing, was an acquaintance of my parents.
sentences.chinese: 逃生的人裏面有一個叫羅廣斌的是我父母的熟人。

sentences.english: And with people you know well, you could also say something nice about their appearance.
sentences.chinese: 對於熟人，你也可以誇誇他們的衣着。

sentences.english: Such, although friend goes by beside, I also look not clear.
sentences.chinese: 這樣，即使熟人從身邊走過去，我也看不清。

sentences.english: You have the privilege of catching your girlfriend in the arms of your acquaintances.
sentences.chinese: 你有在你熟人的懷裏抓住你女朋友的特權。

sentences.english: Try these tests on your acquaintances.
sentences.chinese: 用這些試題去考考你的熟人吧。

sentences.english: Motor mouth chemistry. Otherwise, all you have is a fond acquaintanceship.
sentences.chinese: 否則，你擁有的就只是一個喜歡的熟人。

sentences.english: Have but few friend, though much acquaintance.
A college acquaintance is afraid of train whistles.
sentences.chinese: 一位大學熟人害怕火車汽笛。

sentences.english: Start by identifying the right senior-level contact and find a mutual acquaintance who might provide you with a personal referral.
sentences.chinese: 先確定你要找的高管，找到你們雙方的熟人做引薦。

sentences.english: To avoid being identified by his acquaintances, Wu wore a mask and a pair of dark glasses at first.
sentences.chinese: 爲了避免被熟人認出來，起初吳政會帶上口罩和墨鏡。

definition: to be well acquainted with/to know well
to reminisce/to talk about former times
a relative (i.e. family relation)/CL:門|门[men2],個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
old friend/sb who passed the county level imperial exam (in Ming dynasty)
fellow townsman/fellow villager/sb from the same hometown
to greet sb by word or action/to give prior notice
to worm one's way into being friends with sb (usually derogatory)
